parties.raw_snippet: THIS MEDIA LICENSE AGREEMENT (this “Agreement”) is made and effective as of the date of the Closing (as defined in the Merger Agreement (as defined below)) (the “Effective Date”), between NATIONAL FOOTBALL MUSEUM, INC., an Ohio non-profit corporation, doing business as Pro Football Hall of Fame (“PFHOF”), HOF Village Media Group, LLC (the “Village Media Company”), a Delaware limited liability company that is a wholly-owned subsidiary of HOF Village, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“HOFV”) and, solely for purposes of Section 4.5, HOFV; each a “Party” and collectively, the “Parties”.
parties.reasoning: The opening recital names the contracting entities and labels them as "Party/Parties." This sentence identifies the organizations entering into the Agreement.

contract_type.reasoning: The title and the substance of the Agreement (Section 2: PFHOF grants the Village Media Company rights and a license to Exploit PFHOF Works, with associated License Fees and Annual Guarantee) indicate the primary purpose is granting media/IP licenses.

notice_period.raw_snippet: Thereafter, the agreement shall automatically renew for successive five (5)-year terms, unless either Party gives written notice to the other Party of intent not to renew at least six (6) months prior to the expiration of the then-current Term.
notice_period.reasoning: This sentence in Section 4.1 specifies the advance written notice required to prevent automatic renewal (the notice period prior to expiration of the then-current Term).

expiration_date.raw_snippet: Unless otherwise terminated as provided herein, the term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall terminate on December 31, 2034 (such period, including as may be extended in accordance with the subsequent sentence, the “Term”).
expiration_date.reasoning: Section 4.1 explicitly states the contract terminates on a specific calendar date, December 31, 2034.

renewal_term.raw_snippet: Thereafter, the agreement shall automatically renew for successive five (5)-year terms, unless either Party gives written notice to the other Party of intent not to renew at least six (6) months prior to the expiration of the then-current Term.
renewal_term.reasoning: Section 4.1 states the contract automatically renews for successive five-year terms; this describes the renewal term length and mechanism.

agreement_date.raw_snippet: THIS MEDIA LICENSE AGREEMENT (this “Agreement”) is made and effective as of the date of the Closing (as defined in the Merger Agreement (as defined below)) (the “Effective Date”), between NATIONAL FOOTBALL MUSEUM, INC., an Ohio non-profit corporation, doing business as Pro Football Hall of Fame (“PFHOF”), HOF Village Media Group, LLC (the “Village Media Company”), a Delaware limited liability company that is a wholly-owned subsidiary of HOF Village, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“HOFV”) and, solely for purposes of Section 4.5, HOFV; each a “Party” and collectively, the “Parties”.
agreement_date.reasoning: The agreement header states when the Agreement is "made"; it ties the making to "the date of the Closing," which is not a specific calendar date in the text.

effective_date.raw_snippet: THIS MEDIA LICENSE AGREEMENT (this “Agreement”) is made and effective as of the date of the Closing (as defined in the Merger Agreement (as defined below)) (the “Effective Date”)
effective_date.reasoning: The Agreement explicitly defines the "Effective Date" as "the date of the Closing (as defined in the Merger Agreement...)." No specific calendar date is provided in the contract text.

governing_law.raw_snippet: This Agreement will be governed in all respects by the laws of the State of Ohio (without regard to conflicts of law provisions), as such laws are applied to agreements entered into and to be performed entirely within the State of Ohio between Ohio residents.
governing_law.reasoning: Section 7.4(a) contains the governing law clause specifying the applicable jurisdiction's laws.
